sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The EU threatens further sanctions against Russia after President Vladimir Putin announces plans to move nuclear weapons to neighboring Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Anger erupts across Israel after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu thanks his defense minister for challenging a controversial judicial reform plan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Germany's transport network brought to a near standstill as two of the country's largest unions strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A Berlin climate referendum that strived for carbon neutrality by 2030 has failed after less than 25% of eligible voters turned up to the ballot box.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The search for missing continues after a deadly tornado kills at least 26 people in the US.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The US says it has seen no indication that Russia has moved nuclear weapons to neighboring Belarus, despite President Vladimir Putin announcing plans to station such weapons there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Russian leader's declaration during an interview at the weekend has brought swift condemnation from NATO, calling it dangerous and irresponsible rhetoric.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The EU's foreign policy chief, Joseph Borre, cautioned Belarus against hosting Russian nuclear weapons on its territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Burey tweeted, Belarus hosting Russian nuclear weapons would mean an irresponsible escalation and threat to European security. Belarus can still stop it, it is their choice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The EU stands, ready to respond with further sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Belarusian leader Alexander Lukashenko is a close ally to Putin and allowed his country to be used as staging ground to send Russian troops into Ukraine last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia says the plan to station tactical nuclear weapons in Belarus is in response to the West's increasing military support for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And he notes that Washington has nuclear weapons in Belgium, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands and Turkey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ukraine has demanded an emergency meeting of the UN Security Council.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: An explosion in Russia injured three people, including a 16-year-old girl, on Sunday. Russian authorities blamed a Ukrainian drone for the blast 175 kilometers south of Moscow. Ukraine has not commented on the explosion that reportedly damaged three residential buildings, four houses and created a crater around five meters deep.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The Russian state-run news agency TASS claimed the explosion was caused by a Soviet-made TU-141 drone, which was reintroduced in Ukraine in 2014, after it was tired from service in 1989. Similar drone attacks have been common during the war, although Ukraine hardly ever acknowledges responsibility.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Tens of thousands of Israelis poured onto the streets of cities across the country on Sunday night in an outburst of anger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It followed the sacking of Israel's defense minister by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for challenging the leader's judicial overhaul plan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Protesters in Tel Aviv blocked a main highway and lit large bonfires, while police scuffled with crowds outside Netanyahu's private home in Jerusalem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In a brief televised statement on Saturday, the now former defense minister Yoav Galant had warned that weeks of protests to the judicial plan were a security threat and should be scrapped.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Netanyahu's government is to hold a parliamentary vote this week on a centrepiece of the overhaul, a law that will give the governing coalition the final say over all judicial appointments. It also seeks to pass laws to grant Parliament the authority to override Supreme Court decisions with a basic majority and limit judicial review of laws.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: with a basic majority and limit judicial review of laws.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Critics say the reforms will remove checks and balances on Israel's democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Germans have woken up to a transport network at a near standstill on Monday as two of the country's largest unions strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Staff at airports, railways, buses and subways walked out shortly after midnight for a 24-hour stoppage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The unions are demanding wage increases of more than 10% in order to recover purchasing power lost in recent years. Employers are proposing a 5% increase, with two lump sum payments of up to 1,500 euros. The strikers hope to increase pressure on employers ahead of another round of pay negotiations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This was a culmination of a years-long campaign by a grassroots movement to push Berlin's

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: goal of becoming carbon neutral to 2030.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But that failed in a referendum on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Nearly 51 percent of voters supported the proposal, but the referendum needed 25 percent of eligible voters to cast a ballot for it to succeed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Preliminary results showed the yes side was more than 150,000 votes short.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The weekend's rainy weather didn't help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This demonstration, organized the day before the vote, was expected to draw tens of thousands of people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Activists say they will now look at other ways of pushing a green agenda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There's always protests, demonstrations like we're doing right here, right now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The energy initiatives we want to look into are where people that live in an apartment block come together and figure out how they can have solar panels on their building, figure out how they can regenerate their own power for themselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Conservative Party of the Christian Democratic Union is expected to soon lead Berlin's city hall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: One lawmaker with the party told Euronews that he was against the proposal, saying the time frame was too short and the price too high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: However, he said more does need to be done to deal with climate change and his party is promising billions to tackle the issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The city's goal is to be near climate neutral in 2045, 15 years later than what campaigners wanted. Supporters of the earlier target say they will continue fighting. What I can do is like to support the young youngsters and and make the older people understand these times are over to pollute this earth more and more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Those behind the campaign say they didn't just want to win the referendum, but also show people how to get involved in politics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Making Berlin adhere to its climate goals, making it a more climate-friendly place, but also making sure that citizens are able to take part in climate policy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Christina Jodorowsky, Euronews, Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Search efforts continue after a deadly tornado killed at least 26 people in the southern U.S.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The powerful storm ripped across Mississippi and Alabama, tearing off roofs, smashing cars and leveling entire neighborhoods. President Joe Biden tweeted that he and the first lady were praying for those who have lost loved ones and those whose loved ones are missing, promising full federal support. We hear people need help and it was just devastating last night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Fixed black car, trying to get everybody out, we could get out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Couldn't be a safe location.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We lost everything, but we got our life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Told the house out, told the truck out, the car, and the other cars.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But we did it. As residents come to grips with this devastation, truck out, car, and other cars, but we will.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: As residents come to grips with this devastation, emergency services are now preparing for another round of possible tornadoes Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Cubans went to the polls on Sunday to vote for 470 legislators who will represent them in the National Assembly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Despite fears of rising abstination rates as the government struggles with shortages, inflation and growing social unrest, some 8 million people, more than 70 percent of eligible voters turned out, according to official figures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However, the opposition has called the numbers impossible, dubbing them government mathematics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Initial results are expected later today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Myanmar's junta chief salutes his troops as they march through the country's capital, Naypyidaw, to mark Armed Forces Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The commemoration recognizes the start of local resistance to the Japanese occupation during World War II.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Last week, the U.S. announced new sanctions against Myanmar, targeting aviation fuel suppliers of the military junta.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Critics say the army has repeatedly carried out human rights abuses since seizing power from the elected government in 2021.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Iraq's prime minister has ordered the suspension of working hours in all provinces of the country on account of heavy rainfall and bad weather conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: On the streets of Najaf in southern Iraq, cars, shops and workplaces were submerged while in the neighborhood of Al-Amir, several families had to leave their homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Iraq is the fifth most vulnerable nation in the world to the effects of climate change, including water and food insecurity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Austria is heading for a drought.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Due to lack of rain, the groundwater level is worryingly low in half of the country, especially in the east where the Siksi Lake has dried up completely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Some residents are making the best of the situation, pursuing new hobbies such as searching for coins and jewelry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But they are still in shock about the thousands of fish that died a few months ago. Er sucht neue Hobbys, z.B. für Coins und Jewelry. Aber sie sind immer noch in Schock über die Tausende Fische, die vor ein paar Monaten gestorben sind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Man wusste, dass der ausgetrocknet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Wenn man das früher gemacht hätte, hätten wir da sehr viele Fische retten können.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Und das war verheerend. Da sind Container gestanden, da sind sie mit Bagger gefangen und haben die toten Fische rein und haben sie fortgeführt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Normalerweise müsste hier in den Alpen momentan viel mehr Schnee liegen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Westösterreich gab es in diesem Winter um ein Drittel weniger Niederschlag, dort drüben in Italien sogar um die Hälfte weniger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Und das hat schwerwiegende Konsequenzen für weite Teile Europas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Wir erwarten eine deutlich geringere Schneeschmelze, weniger Schmelzwasser, das den Flüssen zugeführt wird und dann mitunter eine drohende Niederwassersituation in den kommenden Wochen und Monaten.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Wenn wir jetzt in den nächsten Wochen ergiebige Niederschläge messen würden, wie mit diesem Messgerät hier, wäre das fürs Grundwasser noch keine Entspannung.
